creditline: Gift of Michele and David Dewey
description: gourd decorated with horses; flat cover with 7 circular openings, edges with tortoise shell and carved with openwork stars; coiled wire insert (not removed)
medium: Gourd, ivory, tortoise shell, wire, pigment
text: These containers were made from gourds grown inside a wooden or ceramic mold. The shape of the gourd was important because it determined the tone of the cricket's chirp. Crickets spent the cold winter months inside their gourd containers which were warmer than the ceramic summer cages.
title: Cricket Container
